intro: Helopus obtusus, commonly known as the bluntleaf helopus, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies. It typically thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories.
